page.title: 07SAINT PETERS CHURCH CALOW
page.content: The church was built in 1869 but the steeple was added later.There are 6 bells,played by pressing wooden levers.The stained glass windows have pictures of Saints,like St.Nicolas, St.Anne,St.Cecilia and St.Helena.One window has a picture of a choir boy and a boy scout.On the North Wall is a statue of St.George and at the back is a statue of St.Peter,the patron saint of the church.The font at the back has a carved,wooden cover made in 1944. Nearby is a small miners lamp to show that this is a mining area. The organ in the Chancel was first used on Easter Day 1901.The ceiling in the Sanctuary is painted with pictures of God and His Lamb,meaning Wisdom and Peace.This faces East and is the highest part of the church, nearest to God.
